verbs.description: underbuild (third-person singular simple present underbuilds, present participle underbuilding, simple past and past participle underbuilt)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To build beneath another structure; provide a foundation or support for; undergird.
examples: The two eastern arches have been underbuilt for the sake of strengthening them.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To perform insufficient construction on a building or in an area; build below a specified requirement or standard.
examples: Appellee was obliged to overbuild, rather than underbuild, the appellant's telephone line for the distance of these six spans for the following reason [...]
